4414.quoteText: You agree to resolve any Claim you have with us relating to or arising out of our Terms, us, or our Services exclusively in the United States District Court for the Northern District of California or a state court in San Mateo County, California. You also agree to submit to the personal jurisdiction of such courts for the purpose of litigating all such disputes. The laws of the State of California govern our Terms, as well as any disputes, whether in court or arbitration, which might arise between Signal and you, without regard to conflict of law provisions.

4416.quoteText:
We work with third parties to provide some of our Services.
For example, our Third-Party Providers send a verification code to your phone number when you register for our Services.
These providers are bound by their Privacy Policies to safeguard that information.
If you use other Third-Party Services like YouTube, Spotify, Giphy, etc.
in connection with our Services, their Terms and Privacy Policies govern your use of those services.

If you use other Third-Party Services like YouTube, Spotify, Giphy, etc. in connection with our Services, their Terms and Privacy Policies govern your use of those services."

4417.quoteDoc: Signal and the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR)
4417.quoteText: Signal messages and calls cannot be accessed by us or other third parties because they are always end-to-end encrypted, private, and secure.
4417.title: You maintain ownership of your data

tosdr.case: You maintain ownership of your data
tosdr.tldr: "Signal messages, pictures, files, and other contents are stored locally on your device. These contents are readable by the open source Signal clients. Because everything in Signal is end-to-end encrypted, the Signal service does not have access to any of this data. There are several community-developed open source utilities that are capable of parsing locally stored Signal content. Android users can also help us test a new backup feature that makes it possible to move your local Signal data between devices (Signal Settings > Chats and media > Chat backups)."

4419.quoteDoc: Signal and the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR)
4419.quoteText: You can permanently disable your phone number from being recognized as a Signal user by unregistering your phone number here. You will need access to this phone number to verify and complete this action.</p
4419.title: You can delete your content from this service

tosdr.case: You can delete your content from this service
tosdr.tldr: "Signal messages, pictures, files, and other contents are stored locally on your device. These contents are readable by the open source Signal clients. Because everything in Signal is end-to-end encrypted, the Signal service does not have access to any of this data. [...] You can permanently disable your phone number from being recognized as a Signal user by unregistering your phone number here. You will need access to this phone number to verify and complete this action."

4421.quoteText:
Signal may update the Terms from time to time.
When we update our Terms, we will update the “Last Modified” date associated with the updated Terms.
Your continued use of our Services confirms your acceptance of our updated Terms and supersedes any prior Terms.
You will comply with all applicable export control and trade sanctions laws.
Our Terms cover the entire agreement between you and Signal regarding our Services.
If you do not agree with our Terms, you should stop using our Services.
4421.title: Terms may be changed any time at their discretion, without notice to the user

tosdr.case: Terms may be changed any time at their discretion, without notice to the user
tosdr.tldr: The terms of service state: "Signal may update the Terms from time to time. When we update our Terms, we will update the “Last Modified” date associated with the updated Terms. Your continued use of our Services confirms your acceptance of our updated Terms and supersedes any prior Terms. You will comply with all applicable export control and trade sanctions laws. Our Terms cover the entire agreement between you and Signal regarding our Services. If you do not agree with our Terms, you should stop using our Services."

4438.quoteText: You may optionally add other information to your account, such as a profile name and profile picture. This information is end-to-end encrypted.
4438.title: The service allows you to use pseudonyms

tosdr.case: The service allows you to use pseudonyms
tosdr.tldr: The terms state: "You may optionally add other information to your account, such as a profile name and profile picture. This information is end-to-end encrypted." The profile name is therefore not visible to Signal (and hence they cannot determine what it should say). The terms also otherwise do not mention restrictions on the name you choose.

4440.quoteDoc: Grand jury subpoena for Signal user data, Eastern District of Virginia
4440.quoteText:
the only information we can produce in response to a request like this is the date and time a user registered with Signal and the last date of a user’s connectivity to the Signal service.

Notably, things we don’t have stored include anything about a user’s contacts (such as the contacts themselves, a hash of the contacts, any other derivative contact information), anything about a user’s groups (such as how many groups a user is in, which groups a user is in, the membership lists of a user’s groups), or any records of who a user has been communicating with.

All message contents are end-to-end encrypted, so we don’t have that information either.
4440.title: Only necessary user logs are kept by the service to ensure quality

tosdr.case: Only necessary user logs are kept by the service to ensure quality
tosdr.tldr: "We’ve designed the Signal service to minimize the data we retain about Signal users, so the only information we can produce in response to a request like this is the date and time a user registered with Signal and the last date of a user’s connectivity to the Signal service."

6207.title: Your personal data is aggregated into statistics

tosdr.case: Your personal data is aggregated into statistics
tosdr.tldr: A commit to the Signal-Server repository on GitHub is titled, "Tally active users by time interval by platform and by country"
